```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
data <- data.frame( id = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5,6,6), 
                    fulname = c("John Ola", "Alice Bola", NA, "Mike Anu", "Mike Modupe","Sarah Bolu", "Sarah"),
                    age = c(25, NA, 35, 40, 40, 30, 30), 
                    gender = c("M", "F", "M", NA, "M","F","F"),
                    class = c("SS1", "SS2","SS1", "SS2","SS1", "SS2", "SS3"),
                    salary = c(50000, 60000, NA,2000,70000, 80000,80000))

data
```
```{r}

data |> 
  mutate( percentnum = (salary / sum(salary, na.rm = TRUE) * 100))
```

```{r}
library(tidyr)

data %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = gender, values_from = c(salary))

# The 'wide_data' data frame will have 'M' and 'F' as columns with corresponding values


data %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = gender, values_from = salary, names_prefix = "Salary_")
```
```{r}
library(tidyr)

wide_data <- data.frame(
  ID = c(1, 2, 3),
  Name = c("John", "Alice", "Mike"),
  Age_M = c(25, 30, 35),
  Age_F = c(NA, 35, 40),
  Salary_M = c(50000, 60000, 70000),
  Salary_F = c(55000, 60000, 72000)
)


long_data <- wide_data %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = starts_with("Age_") | starts_with("Salary_"),
    names_to = c(".value", "gender"),
    names_pattern = "(Age|Salary)_(.)"
  )
long_data
# The 'long_data' data frame will have separate rows for age and salary for males and females.

```
